page.title: 04WORTHING CREMATORIUM
page.content: The crematorium was opened in l968 by Worthing Borough Council. There are 3,500 services annually, with 75% ashes interred and 25% taken away. There are nine permanent staff. There was a manor on the site for over 600 years and the present entrance was for tradesmen. One third of the drive belongs to the crematorium. the rest to sixteen different owners. Development of the area is opposed. The catchment area extends from Horsham in the north to Uckfield in the east, Shoreham in the south and west to Bognor. Behind the crematorium is the private burial ground of the Thynne family, which is still in use.
